radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal on day 5, by day 8 a subtle focus of T2 hyperintensity in the left thalamus, by day 10 the lesion became more conspicuous with new symmetric hyperintensity in the substantia nigra, by day 18 several symmetric foci in the thalamus, substantia nigra, pons, and dentate nuclei of the cerebellum, and by day 36 abnormalities extended to the red nuclei and globus pallidus.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive involvement of gray matter structures over 5 weeks, with initial normal findings, subtle changes by day 8, more pronounced findings by day 10, and extensive abnormalities observed by day 36.
